name: AI Day Trading Agent Knowledge Base
description: A comprehensive, structured, and quantitatively deep knowledge base about day trading, synthesized for a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) AI system. Version 3.3 includes new documents on advanced post-trade analysis, data hygiene, system resilience, and execution algorithms.

files.description: Defines the fundamental concepts and quantitative characteristics of day trading (timeframe, frequency, holding period), its distinction from investing, and the key advantages an AI agent has over human traders. Includes common beginner misconceptions to avoid.

Details the multi-layered, hierarchical risk management system. Covers Layer 1 (Single-Trade protocols like the 1% Rule), Layer 2 (Portfolio-Level protocols like max sector exposure), and Layer 3 (System-Level circuit breakers like trailing drawdown and VIX scaling).

Explains common cognitive biases (FOMO, Revenge Trading, Complacency, Confirmation Bias) and provides their quantitative signatures for AI detection. Details specific, programmable AI countermeasures for each bias.

Provides a detailed comparative analysis of Equities, Forex, and Crypto markets. Includes critical AI Agent Implications regarding operational hours (24/7), data requirements, capital constraints, and necessary risk controls for each market.

A deep-dive guide for the AI's situational awareness module. Details the quantitative analysis of VIX for volatility, ADX for trend, and Time of Day. Provides the logic for creating a machine-readable 'market_regime' state object and the ADK implementation pattern for updating it.
Outlines the agent's operational state machine for a trading day (Pre-Market, Open, Mid-Day, Close, Post-Market), detailing the active modules, key data inputs, and constraints for each state.

Details the four-stage data processing pipeline for creating a ranked daily watchlist, including universe filtering, dynamic gapper scanning (RVOL, Gap %), NLP-based catalyst scoring, and a final weighted ranking algorithm.

The definitive, end-to-end technical blueprint for the AI agent's pre-market analysis and watchlist generation pipeline. Consolidates and expands upon other documents, incorporating advanced quantitative metrics, market-specific models, an ML-powered feedback loop, and ADK implementation patterns.

Defines a hierarchical trade execution logic, including pre-entry prerequisite checks (market regime, broad market filter) and explicit, programmable rules for entry, exit, and in-trade management (scaling, trailing stops).

Explains the critical feedback loop of journaling. Specifies essential data points for an algorithmic journal and details the Automated Feedback Loop Implementation using an ADK LoopAgent for self-optimization.

Details a sophisticated, quantitative algorithm for selecting and sizing trades from a watchlist to manage correlated risk. The process involves scoring, Hierarchical Risk Parity (HRP) clustering for diversification, and Risk Parity for position sizing.
A guide to advanced post-trade analysis using Maximum Favorable Excursion (MFE) and Maximum Adverse Excursion (MAE) to quantitatively optimize stop-loss and take-profit placement.

The master decision matrix for the AI agent. This document provides a quantitative, rule-based framework for dynamically selecting the optimal trading strategy (Momentum, Breakout, Mean Reversion) based on real-time market conditions, including Time of Day, VIX level, and ADX reading.

A deep dive into the Intraday Momentum strategy. Details the statistical edge from behavioral biases, optimal parameters (13/48 EMA Crossover), and a full quantitative performance analysis based on VIX, ADX, and Time of Day regimes.

A deep dive into the Opening Range Breakout (ORB) strategy. Details the statistical edge from the market open liquidity event, optimal parameters (15-min range, EOC target), and a quantitative performance analysis based on VIX and prior day's ADX.

A deep dive into the Intraday Mean Reversion strategy. Details the statistical edge from behavioral overreactions, optimal parameters (RSI(9), BB(10, 1.5)), a quantitative performance analysis, and a critical AI guardrail to prevent its use in trending markets.

A deep dive into high-frequency Scalping. Defines quantitative prerequisites (liquidity, spread) and provides pseudocode for two specific AI architectures: Passive Market Making and Aggressive Order Flow Imbalance. Details the required hybrid 'two-speed brain' ADK architecture.

A deep dive into News-Based Trading. Provides two programmable tactics (Volatility Straddle, Data Deviation) and a detailed ADK Implementation Pipeline using a SequentialAgent and FunctionTools for processing unstructured news with NLP.

An algorithmic guide to identifying classic intraday chart patterns. Translates visual patterns like Bull Flags, Pennants, Triangles, and Head & Shoulders into quantifiable characteristics and pseudocode for AI detection. Includes specific entry, stop-loss, and profit target rules for each pattern.

A reference library of essential technical indicators, including a crucial section on the Hierarchy and Role of Indicators (Trend, Momentum, Volatility, Volume) to ensure confirmation and avoid multicollinearity in AI strategy design.
Explains the hierarchy of market data (L1, L2, Tape) and provides concrete, programmable rules with pseudocode for an AI to 'read the tape' by detecting patterns like Absorption and Iceberg Orders.

Provides an overview of the essential software stack, translating each component into its role for an AI. Details how the agent programmatically integrates with Charting Platforms, Scanners, and News APIs.

An in-depth analysis of EOD Historical Data (EODHD). Includes a ranked justification for its primary recommendation, focusing on architectural simplification, TCO, and its official asynchronous Python client for ADK implementation.

A comparative analysis of Polygon.io and Alpha Vantage, including a Strategic Recommendation Matrix that guides the AI on which provider to select based on project phase (Prototyping vs. Production) and primary objective (Latency vs. Balanced).

A professional playbook for using technical indicators in combination for high-probability signals. Details the principle of Signal Confluence and provides specific, multi-indicator combinations and programmable rules for Momentum, Breakout, and Mean Reversion strategies.

A deep dive into algorithmic trade execution. Provides a decision-theoretic framework for advanced order types (Market, Limit, Stop-Limit), quantitative slippage models, and resilient broker API interaction patterns like the Token Bucket algorithm and Exponential Backoff with Jitter.

A methodological guide to the quantitative trading model development lifecycle. Covers predictive feature engineering (Log Returns, ROC, OFI), a decision framework for model selection (ARIMA vs. XGBoost vs. LSTM), and rigorous data hygiene protocols to prevent data leakage.
A practical guide for using the EODHD API to power the data ingestion and analysis modules of the AI trading agent, with a focus on the official `eodhd` Python library.
A detailed protocol for cleaning and preparing financial time-series data, covering missing data, corporate actions, outliers, and survivorship bias.
A deep dive into institutional-grade execution algorithms like TWAP and VWAP for minimizing market impact on large orders.
Details the strategy for using real-time SEC filings (Forms 4, 8-K) as a source of high-alpha trading signals, including keyword analysis and recommended API providers.
Explores the use of supply chain data (e.g., shipping manifests) for predictive analytics, including key data types, leading providers, and a hypothetical FunctionTool implementation.
Outlines a methodology for quantifying geopolitical risk by adapting the GPR Index methodology for a high-frequency news feed and compares this approach to commercial providers.

A definitive guide to the US FINRA Pattern Day Trader (PDT) Rule. Includes explicit AI Implementation Logic with required state variables (`day_trade_counter`, `is_pdt_flagged`) and pseudocode for compliance checks.

Explains the Canadian regulatory environment (CIRO). Includes a critical new section on account type rules, explicitly forbidding day trading in registered accounts (TFSA/RRSP) and explaining cash account violations.

A fiscal guide for Québec traders. Includes a new 'Key AI Agent Directives' section that translates the tax analysis into hard-coded rules for expense tracking, tax form data, and an alert trigger for incorporation.

Explains margin and leverage. Includes a new, detailed 'Quantitative Example of a Margin Call' section, providing a step-by-step calculation an AI agent can run to continuously monitor its margin health and prevent forced liquidation.

Outlines broker selection criteria with a new 'Ranked Decision-Making Hierarchy'. This provides a sequential decision flow for the AI, prioritizing API access and regulatory compliance before cost and features.

An in-depth analysis of Interactive Brokers (IBKR). Includes a new 'AI Agent-Specific Assessment' section that scores the broker against the ranked criteria and notes how its TWS API fits into an ADK FunctionTool.

An in-depth analysis of Questrade. Includes a new 'AI Agent-Specific Assessment' section that scores the broker, highlighting its key advantage (no PDT enforcement) and disadvantages (high FX fees) for an AI.

Provides a head-to-head comparison and features a new 'Decision Flowchart for AI Agent', a structured, step-by-step logic tree the AI can follow to select the optimal broker based on capital and objectives.
A practical guide for using the Interactive Brokers API via the `ib_insync` library for order execution, portfolio management, and high-fidelity data.

Outlines a robust, event-driven system architecture using GCP and Firebase. Includes a new 'ADK Implementation Strategy' section that explicitly maps architectural components to ADK classes like LlmAgent, FunctionTool, and callbacks.

Details the science of strategy validation. Features a new 'Backtesting Engine Architecture' section with explicit pseudocode for an event-driven backtesting loop, making the concept directly translatable to Python code.

Explains market microstructure for AI agents. Features a new 'AI Agent's Tactical Response' section with concrete rules for how the agent should dynamically adjust its behavior (e.g., order types) based on real-time liquidity data.

Addresses AI-specific challenges like 'alpha decay'. Features a new 'ADK-Native Implementation Framework' section detailing a self-improving agent using a LoopAgent and FunctionTools for a continuous feedback loop.

An advanced guide for agentic AI development. Covers HFT context, latency analysis, advanced backtesting (Monte Carlo, Walk-Forward), and AI-specific challenges, with explicit implementation strategies using the Google ADK framework.

Provides practical, executable Python code examples and design patterns for core AI agent modules using the Google ADK framework. Includes implementations for the Risk Governor (before_tool_callback), Volatility Circuit Breaker (before_agent_callback), and the Automated Feedback Loop (LoopAgent).
An overview of the different Machine Learning models (ARIMA, SVM, LSTMs) and their applications in trading, including predictive modeling and sentiment analysis.
A detailed, practical guide to building a Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) neural network for stock price prediction, including a step-by-step Python tutorial.
A guide to using Reinforcement Learning (RL) to develop adaptive trading strategies, including how to build a custom trading environment in Python.
A guide to using Natural Language Processing (NLP) for financial sentiment analysis, covering dictionary-based methods, FinBERT, and LLMs, with a Python code example.

Details protocols for handling technical and operational risks such as connectivity loss, API downtime, and data feed corruption, including the implementation of a heartbeat system and circuit breakers.
